runs.comm: full and slightly wide outside off stump, the left-hand batsman lets it go across him
a length ball outside off stump and de Kock cracks it through covers off the front foot, the outfield is slow because of the rain but the ball still beats the pursuing fielder
cut hard off the front foot towards point, where Shehzad dives to take pace off the ball, good stop, saved three runs for Pakistan
Amla goes deep into his crease, moving back and across to defend on the off side
135.7 kph, a full ball on the pads, Amla leans across in his crease and flicks the ball firmly to the fine-leg boundary
Amla has a hard slash at a length ball outside off and is beaten, the Pakistan players appeal for a caught behind but the umpire says not out
driven uppishly towards the fielder at cover point
a fuller ball angling into the left-hander's pads, de Kock flicks along the ground through midwicket
driven on the up towards wide mid-on, the batsmen start running once the ball beats extra cover
133 kph, a risky run after Amla drops the ball close on the off side, de Kock initiated it and Amla responded quickly. Shezad fired the throw at the bowler's end but missed.
chipped in the air towards mid-on
makes room by moving towards leg and drives on the up on the off side
Amla drives from his crease and away from his body, the ball pitches on a good length and nips slightly into the right-hander, beating the inside edge of the bat
width outside off stump and the length is just right for Amla to lean forward and flay the ball through cover point, a full swish of the bat and the ball races across this damp outfield
played back to the bowler on the front foot
Amla's bat comes down with a whiplash once again and the ball screams through cover. He moved forward to a length ball and played a flowing drive. Too much width from Ali
a slower ball and Amla gets an inside edge on the leg side when he was trying to push on the off

that's quite an amazing shot. The ball was full and outside off stump, de Kock leaned forward and across and used his wrists to whip it through midwicket, beating the fielder at deep square leg. Superb timing and he played that all along the ground
poor line, full outside leg stump, Amla simply leans across in his crease and flicks to the backward square leg boundary
oh my, the ball's going to all parts of the Wanderers! Another full ball on the pads, Amla flicks in front of square leg, he'll hit those all day and night
nudged off the pads through square once again
strays down leg side this time, a pretty horrific start from Pakistan

de Kock steps out of his crease and swings his bat like a golf club, he was aiming straight down the ground but ended up hitting the ball wide of the fielder at mid-on, and the timing is good enough to take it to the boundary
played from his crease towards point
played off the pads behind square
good length around off stump, de Kock drives from his crease and mis-times it on the off side
phew! De Kock has latched on to a slightly short delivery, getting into position in a flash to pull the ball between midwicket and mid-on. He hit that off the front foot. Dismissive
and now Junaid's given him a little width outside off and de Kock frees his arms and lashes it through point with a fierce cut
that's not that short and de Kock mis-times the pull to midwicket

carnage at Wanderers. De Kock charges at the bowler, Junaid bowls a full toss wide outside off, de Kock reaches for it, lunging to his left, and manages to flat-bat it past the bowler and between mid-off and mid-on
defended on the back foot
Amla leans forward and drives towards mid-off
goes round the wicket to the left-hander, de Kock defends
played from the crease on the leg side
that's some touch from Amla, who somehow makes the width to square drive the ball off the back foot through cover, he moved towards leg ever so slightly
nudged towards long-on for a single
de Kock stays in his crease and cuts the ball hard towards point, he hit that from in front of his stumps
nudged off the pads on the leg side for a single
that's streaky, de Kock was aiming for the big heave over midwicket, the ball pitched outside leg and angled across the left-hander, it flew off the outside edge to the third man boundary
fuller and straighter from Bhatti, de Kock flicks off the pads through square
good length outside off at 142 kph, Amla punches from his crease to cover
Amla presses forward and drives a length ball powerfully through cover, there's a fielder in the deep now
139 kph, the bouncer is too high, de Kock lets it go over his head
de Kock charges and moves outside leg, Bhatti counters with a short of a length slower ball, de Kock doesn't have the room and he works it off his hips on the leg side
makes room by moving outside leg, Hafeez pauses in his action and then delivers, de Kock plays the ball to cover
driven towards long-off for a single
Amla flicks from his crease through square leg
de Kock swings across the line but mis-hits the ball towards square leg, he was aiming for midwicket

he's bowled him! Off stump has been uprooted. Amla tried to drive through cover from his crease but the ball was full and he ended up yorking himself and missed it. Finally Pakistan have some reason to cheer
played off the front foot towards long-off
played off the back foot in front of square leg
de Kock stays back and taps the ball off his pads behind square leg

there's a mix-up and de Kock was gone if the fielder had hit at the bowler's end! Du Plessis pushed off the front foot close on the off side and the fielder got to the ball quickly. Faf said no right away but de Kock had run a fair way down the pitch. Luckily for him, the fielder missed
driven through cover for a single
played off the pads through square leg for one more
du Plessis drives on the off side
de Kock's smashed the ball hard and straight at Faf, who wears it on the arm at the non-striker's end, they don't run off the rebound
de Kock heaves across the line and is beaten outside off stump
he's smashed that so hard, making room and swinging powerfully after taking two steps out of his crease, the ball skids past the fielder at long-off

that's superbly caught on the long-on boundary! De Kock was aiming for the innings' first six but mis-hit the ball towards long-on. It nearly carried too! Tanvir was on the boundary and he took a few steps back and to his left to catch the ball right on the edge. He kept his balance to give Pakistan their second wicket
played uppishly through cover point for a single
played on the off side
driven along the ground through the off side
pushed off the front foot close on the off side for a quick single
stays in his crease and nudges towards midwicket for one more
Faf strides forward and pushes the ball towards wide mid-on, Afridi chases after it himself

Afridi's gone through Davids with the one that skids through straight on. The ball zipped off the pitch quickly and Davids had hardly begun playing his prod from his crease. The ball went off the bottom edge on to the pad and then on to the sumps. Davids was cramped for room
played off the front foot to cover point
driven on the up through cover point for a single
a full ball on leg and middle, JP drives from his crease towards mid-on
Duminy strides forward and plays a punchy drive towards mid-off
a full ball on the pads, Duminy puts it away by leaning towards the off side on the front foot and flicking firmly through midwicket
tucked off the pads once again, to deep square for a single though
Afridi bowls the ball that slides across the left-hander, Duminy goes back into his crease and blocks
goes back once again to push the ball towards long off
Afridi chases after the ball after du Plessis moves forward and nudges it towards the vacant space at mid-on
driven on the front foot to long on
bowled quicker and straighter, du Plessis comes forward and works the ball in front of square leg
that's outside leg stump, Duminy goes back and plays the ball through square
comes out of his crease and towards the off side to nudge the ball between mid-on and midwicket
Du Plessis makes room by moving outside leg, Hafeez follows  him and the batsman clips towards square leg
Duminy nudges the ball on the leg side for a single
Du Plessis steps out of his crease and nudges the ball gently through midwicket, by the time the fielder comes in from the deep, they have time to take the second
another double, they hare between the wickets after du Plessis works the ball through square off the front foot
du Plessis moves far outside leg stump and is followed by the bowler, he flicks again towards long leg but gets only the single this time
Du Plessis comes out of his crease and defends awkwardly on the off side
nudges it from his crease through midwicket
Afridi zips the ball across the left-hander after pitching on middle and off, Duminy trips to late cut and misses
defended on the back foot on the leg side
I think he's dropped that! Or has he? Duminy tried to drive off the front foot away from his body and the ball slid across him, that sounded like an edge but the keeper could not catch it
defended on the leg side, that's the end of an economical spell from Afridi
du Plessis backed away towards leg to make room for the pull shot, but the short of a length delivery skidded on to him much too quickly and he got a top edge that fell short of third man
mis-timed but Duminy manages to slug the ball over the fielder at midwicket
the slower ball gone wrong, it's a full toss on the pads, luckily for the bowler Faf's glance isn't good enough to beat fine leg

that's his first wicket in T20 internationals! Bhatti bowled another short of a length delivery that was on to the left-hander too quickly as he pulled of the front foot. The ball made contact with the high part of Duminy's bat and went flat and low towards midwicket, where Hafeez dived forward to hold the catch
that's too quick for him, short of a length at searing pace across the left-hander, Miller tries to slash at it but misses
Miller closes the face too early as the ball slants across him from over the wicket, he gets a leading edge through cover
they run a risky single after Miller plays the ball straight to the fielder at midwicket, Hafeez's throw to the striker's end misses the stumps
that's too short, Du Plessis waits in his crease and then moves forward to pull it into the gap at deep midwicket

caught at mid-off this time! Du Plessis steps out of his crease and makes room by moving outside leg to try and hit the ball over extra cover. The delivery is short of a length and angling across the right-hander from over the wicket, du Plessis bat turns in his had as it makes contact with the ball and he  gives mid-off a simple catch
defended on the leg side
Parnell tries to work the ball off his pads but misses
Parnell plays the ball with the angle into him behind square, an inside edge on to the pad
Parnell stays back in his crease and pushes the ball that hurries on to him towards mid off
Miller tees off, swinging hard across the line at a short of a length ball that's pretty quick, he misses the pull shot

that's huge! The first six of the innings. Bhatti's length was a touch short and this time Miller was ready and waiting. He took two steps forward and pulled hard, sending the ball into the stands at deep midwicket
a low full toss and Miller has drilled it to the long-off boundary, the fielder at mid-off dived to his left but he had no chance
in the blockhole outside off and Miller squeezes it through cover point

that's a fast and high full toss, that will be a no-ball. Parnell backed away and swung and the ball flew miles in the air off the top edge and was caught at deep cover. The batsmen had started running the second before the fielder caught it
Parnell's been run out, he attempted a non-existent third run after playing the ball down the ground towards long off and wasn't even in the frame when Bhatti broke the stumps
Steyn dabs his first ball towards third man to give Miller the strike

shot! Miller moves outside leg stump and drives a full ball over the fielder in the circle at cover, he picked his gap in the deep and found it perfectly. He did not have room to play that shot, terrific execution
that's a fast bouncer and it beats miller's hook
Junaid's hobbling in pain after Miller cracks a low full toss with immense power back at the bowler and hits the left ankle
Steyn clears his front foot and tries to hit the ball over the midwicket boundary, he misses

that's superbly caught by the substitute Abdur Rehman, running in from the third-man boundary. Steyn slashed at a short of a length delivery angling across him from over the wicket and top edged it. Rehman came running in from the deep and dived forward to get his hands under the ball
in the blockhole from round the wicket, Miller stays balanced in his crease and square drives through the off side
Morkel tries to hit down the ground but hits it into the pitch and towards the bowler
Morkel's clobbered this! He pulls the short ball with tremendous power and beats the fielder diving to his left at long on
what's Tanvir doing? He's bowled a wide full toss and Morkel's driven it into the gap on the cover boundary
in the blockhole outside off stump this time and Morkel is beaten, Miller won't have the strike for the final ball. I can't understand why they did not try to run a bye to the keeper
that's a poor finish from Pakistan, Tanvir beat Morkel with a slower ball but the keeper missed it and the effort from the fielder at fine leg was poor too
